title: Young man hacked dead in Rangpur
body: A young man was killed in an attack by unidentified assailants at Gangachara upazila of Rangpur. The incident took place at about 11:00pm on Monday at the Bhutka Madhyapara area of Gangachara Sadar upazila Union of the district. The victim was Akherul Islam, 35, who was the son of Shamsuddin Miah, resident of Bhutka, Madhyapara village of the upazila. He had been working at a private courier service in Keraniganj, Dhaka, and returned home about a month ago after leaving the job. According to the police and local people, Akherul was returning home from nearby Maliper Bazar when he was hacked on his forehead by unknown assailants, who left him on the roadside. Locals later found him lying there and informed the police. Akherulâ€™s younger brother, Akhtarul Islam, said that his brother had received several phone calls in the evening while at home and during one of those calls, Akherul got into an argument with someone on the other end of the line. The officer-in-charge of Gongachara police station, Md Abdus Sobur said that they recovered the dead body, sent it to Rangpur Medical College Hospital morgue, and no case was filed yet. Rangpur Additional Superintendent of Police, Crime and Operations, Sushanta Chandra Roy said that the police began investigation of the incident with utmost importance and the exact cause of death will be confirmed when the autopsy is done.
